Description: Book of the Dead of Ankhes; Hieratic text; black line offering-vignette to right.
Curator's comments: Black line vignette of deceased adoring Osiris sitting on a throne before an offering table. Above the figures are seven columns of cursive Hieroglyphic text written in black ink with black dividing lines, naming the deceased and Osiris. The scene is enclosed with black lines and occupies the height of the papyrus and roughly a third the width of the sheet. To the right of the vignette is one column of Hieratic text written in black ink, occupying the remaining two-thirds of sheet. Not much damage, some at top and to right of sheet.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (16)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134540) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134540)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Backed: white paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: leather (deteriorated), scotch magic tape 810 Object Priority: B Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
